isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - MODULAR CONTROL VALVE (MV-3) - REASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: REASSEMBLE
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 45 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install O-rings (Item 11, 12 and 13) onto the shuttle valve (Item 10). Then install the assembly (small end first) into the MV-3 valve body.
Install the retaining ring (Item 9) making sure it's fully seated in its groove.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 46 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install O-rings (Items 5, 6, and 7) and the exhaust seal (Item 2) onto the main spool (Item 4).

note.para: The exhaust seal (Item 2) must be installed so that its beveled surface mates with the beveled surface of the main spool (Item 4).
The spools in the MV-3 are the same length and are interchangeable.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 45 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install O-ring (Item 17) onto the guide spool (Item 26) and O-ring (Item 20) onto the guide cap (Item 25). Place the guide cap on top of the guide spool and install entire assembly over the threaded end of the main spool (Item 22) and press down firmly until it snaps into place.

Install spring (Item 14) over the boss in the bottom of the main spool cavity in the body of the valve. Place the main spool assembly into the valve body, keeping the spool square to the body. Press and turn the stem until the spool is fully seated in its cavity. The assembly is keyed and may only be installed one way.
Repeat steps 3, 4 and 5 with the opposite main spool.
Install O-ring (Item 4) into its groove on the piston (Item 3) and O-ring (Item 2) onto the retainer cap (Item 24).
Install spring (Item 5) on the piston (Item 3) and spring (Item 6) on the boss of the check valve (Item 7).
Install the spring and check valve into its cavity in the valve body (tapered end of check valve to enter cavity first). Make sure the spring (Item 6) is centered in the bore.
Install the piston assembly into the cavity making sure the spring (Item 6) mates with the bore of the piston.
Install the retainer cap (Item 24) with O-ring (Item 2).
Fasten the cover (Item 21) to the valve with six screws (Item 23). Tighten the screw to 25 in-lbs. (2.83 N · m).

Attach the red and yellow knobs (Item 1) onto the threaded spools, making sure that they are installed on the proper spool as noted in step 1 of
DISASSEMBLE
